security_audit.summary: The skill-creator is a legitimate development utility that creates skill templates, validates YAML frontmatter, and packages skills into zip files. All operations are local file system operations. The 106 static findings are false positives caused by the analyzer misinterpreting: (1) Apache License URLs as network indicators, (2) markdown backtick formatting as shell command execution, (3) SHA256 hashes and content hash identifiers as weak cryptographic algorithms, and (4) standard documentation patterns as C2 indicators. No malicious intent or dangerous patterns exist.

content.user_title: Create Custom AI Skills with Templates
content.value_statement: Building AI skills from scratch requires understanding Claude's skill architecture, YAML frontmatter, and proper file organization. This tool provides templates, validation, and packaging to create professional skills quickly.
actual_capabilities: Generates skill templates with proper YAML frontmatter structure
Validates skill structure and required metadata fields
Packages skills into distributable zip files
Creates example scripts, references, and assets directories
limitations: Only creates skill scaffolding - content must be added manually
Validation checks structure but not content quality or usefulness
No built-in testing framework for skill functionality
Requires understanding of skill architecture before use

best_practices: Start with concrete examples of how the skill will be used before writing content
Follow the progressive disclosure principle - keep SKILL.md concise and detailed docs in references/
Test skills with real tasks before packaging for distribution
anti_patterns: Don't include sensitive credentials or API keys in skill files
Avoid duplicating content between SKILL.md and reference documents
Don't create overly broad skills - focus on specific, well-defined tasks

faq.question: What file formats are supported for skills?
faq.answer: Skills use YAML frontmatter in SKILL.md files. Scripts can be Python, Bash, or any executable format.

faq.question: Is there a size limit for skill content?
faq.answer: SKILL.md should stay under 5,000 words. Reference files can be larger and are loaded on-demand.

faq.question: Can skills include external dependencies?
faq.answer: Yes, scripts can import standard libraries. For external packages, include installation instructions.

faq.question: How do I validate my skill before packaging?
faq.answer: Run the quick_validate.py script to check YAML frontmatter and required fields before packaging.

faq.question: What naming conventions should I follow?
faq.answer: Use hyphen-case (lowercase with hyphens). Names must match the directory name exactly.

faq.question: Can I update an existing skill?
faq.answer: Yes, edit the SKILL.md file and resource directories, then re-package using the packaging script.
